head.title: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

hedline.hl1: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and the Treasury's quarterly refunding including five- and 10-year notes and a 30-year bond. The refunding begins tomorrow with the sale of $10 billion of five-year notes, followed by $10 billion of 10-year notes on Wednesday and $5 billion of 30-year bonds on Thursday.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.03 percent and on the six-month issue, 6.02 percent. In when-issued trading, the five-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.00 percent, the 10-year note at 5.78 percent and the 30-year bond at 5.76 percent.

The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and the Treasury's quarterly refunding including five- and 10-year notes and a 30-year bond. The refunding begins tomorrow with the sale of $10 billion of five-year notes, followed by $10 billion of 10-year notes on Wednesday and $5 billion of 30-year bonds on Thursday.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.03 percent and on the six-month issue, 6.02 percent. In when-issued trading, the five-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.00 percent, the 10-year note at 5.78 percent and the 30-year bond at 5.76 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Calpine Corp., $800 million of senior notes in two parts: $250 million of five-year notes and $550 million of 10-year notes. ---/BB+/---. Credit Suisse First Boston.
CIT Group, $750 million of an intermediate global bond. Chase H& Q.
Duke Energy Field Services, $1.5 billion of debt securities in two parts. Baa2/BBB/---. J. P. Morgan Securities and Merrill Lynch & Co.
(Source: MCM CorporateWatch)
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX-EXEMPT TUESDAY
Los Angeles, CTFS Partners, equipment program, $56.3 million of certificate of participation. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Chicago, $180 million of general obligation project and refunding bonds. First Albany Corp.
Colorado Springs, $59 million of debt securities for Memorial Hospital. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Denver Airport, $270 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Harlandale, Tex., Independent School District, $55 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Montana Board of Housing, $75 million of debt securities. PaineWebber.
Oklahoma Capital Improvement Authority, $150 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Route 3 North Transportation Improvement Association, $375 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
University of Puerto Rico, $200 million of debt securities. PaineWebber.
